title: Shannon Ridge 2013 Buck Shack Red (Lake County)
description: Bold in flavor and full bodied, this dry wine will taste great with steak or lamb chops. It has a very deep color, full aromas like dark chocolate and blackberry, and concentrated dark-fruit flavors. Moderate tannins give welcome grip to the texture.

title: ZinPhomaniac 2014 Old Vine Cuvée Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Fueled by loads of fresh fruit flavor, this is a full-bodied and generous-tasting wine. Tempting cedar and pine aromas lead to raspberry, cherry and blackberry notes that are almost sweet and last long on the finish.

title: VGS Chateau Potelle 2015 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: Tropical papaya meets moderate acidity in this lush, creamy and voluptuous version of the variety, complemented by enough minerality to cut through the fleshy ripeness. The oak impact is subtle and plays a supporting role, never distracting from the fruit.

title: WesMar 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Crisp red cherry and a taste of grenadine characterize this light, bright wine, with accents of orange and rhubarb. Fruity and straightforward in structure and body, it retains nicely interwoven acidity through the finish.

title: Angel Vine 2012 Stonetree Vineyard Zinfandel (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vibrant aromas of cranberry, raspberry and red currant are followed by full-bodied jammy red-fruit flavors. It drinks quite sweet but overall holds the sugar well and the acid provides a counterbalance.

title: Anthony Nappa 2013 Enzo Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Named after the winemaker's newborn son, Enzo is a bold unabashedly unique take on Finger Lakes Riesling in the hands of a Long Island producer. Made from grapes frozen on the vine and fermented via indigenous yeast in French oak, it's intensely spicy, wafting of caramel and candied orange rinds. The palate is unctuously honeyed but dusted by layers of earth and mineral. It's a far departure from a classic ice wine yet intriguingly complex and impeccably balanced.

title: Château Moncontour NV Tête de Cuvée Brut  (Vouvray)
description: This wine is well poised between crisp young fruit and a more mature character. Apples and citrus fruits are right up front, balanced by acidity and with nuts and toast flavors developing. That makes for a refreshing wine that is also complex. Drink now.

title: Coffele 2015 Ca' Visco  (Soave Classico)
description: Ripe and creamy, this opens with a heady fragrance white spring flower and exotic fruit. The round expressive palate tastes of peach, pear, lemon drop, grapefruit and wild herb. Hints of white almond and mineral linger on the finish.

title: Covenant 2013 Solomon Lot 70 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft and spicy, this ripe, robust and full-bodied expression of 100% Cabernet Sauvignon is densely concentrated. Black pepper, cedar and leather provide plenty of character and nuance to the power, while the tannins give structure and foundation to the whole.

title: Domaine de la Gaverie 2015 Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Thirty-year-old vines and short wood aging have produced a well-balanced, rich wine that is both dry and fruity. Honey and baked-apple flavors are laced with acidity and softened with wood aging. The wine can be drunk now, although it will be much better from 2019.

title: Domaine de Vodanis 2015  Vouvray
description: A bone-dry wine, this offers apple and honey flavors and intense spice and acidity. It has citrus, minerality, complexity and intense texture. The wine needs to age, so wait until 2019.

title: Basel Cellars 2011 Claret Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (45%) and Cabernet Franc (42%) take the lead on this blend. The aromas suggest notes of dried herb, cherry, vanilla and pencil shavings while the palate offers elegantly styled dark-fruit flavors with toasty accents. It's a very pretty expression of the vintage.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2011 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Smooth true Rioja aromas of ripe and dried berry fruits, tobacco, vanilla and sandalwood do the job, while this feels both racy and cushioned. Flavors of lightly baked berry fruits, tobacco and vanilla finish steadily, with a touch of vanilla from latent oak. Drink through 2019.

title: Campinuovi 2012 Riserva  (Montecucco)
description: Made with organically grown grapes, this opens with aromas of dark berry, violet, truffle and leather. The round chewy palate offers juicy black cherry, cinnamon and a balsamic note alongside soft acidity and supple tannins.

title: Soos Creek 2013 Palisades Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of fruit from Klipsun, Slide Mountain, Elephant Mountain and Ciel du Cheval vineyards, this wine offers generous aromas of raspberries, chocolate and spice. The palate is packed to the brim with fruit flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Quivira 2014 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from certified Biodynamic grapes, this robust, 100% varietal red is lush and spicy, full bodied yet high in acidity and bright, fresh flavor. Red licorice, vanilla bean, baked strawberry and a hit of white pepper combine effortlessly for a satisfying experience.

title: Irwin Family Vineyards 2013 The Bull Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Saturated with color and ripe fruit flavors, this almost-thick wine is medium bodied, mouthcoating and bursting with black cherry and prune flavors. It is dry, moderately tannic in texture and well balanced despite its richness.

title: Januik 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are bright, with notes of green herb, vanilla, clove, wood spice and cherry. The palate brings a mouthful of dark-fruit flavors along with barrel accents, providing a whole lot of texture and appeal.

title: Jax 2014 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Winemaker Kirk Venge coaxes orange blossom perfume from this otherwise velvety, concentrated and youthful white, toasty in caramelized oak. The concentration makes way for a taste of baked apple and pear within a cradle of nuanced acidity.

title: Jax 2014 Y3 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Kirk Venge sources Andy Beckstoffer-grown grapes from Carneros for this impressive value of a wine, fermented in concrete tank and neutral French oak. It delights within a bright context of tangerine and green apple, with integrated oak and a lengthy finish.

title: JCB 2013 No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a big-boned wine, showy in spearmint and eucalyptus, burly blackberry and tar. With integrated oak and tannin, it presents a respectable showing of approachably lush texture and succulence, the finish persistent in juicy fruit.

title: JM Cellars 2013 Margaret's Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Hailing from the winery's young estate vineyard, this 100% varietal wine brings aromas of cocoa, vanilla and cherry—with the barrel influence initially playing prominently. The flavors are jammy, supple and palate coating, bringing a sense of texture and gravitas. The variety seems to get a little lost in the oak and ripeness but it still brings plenty to enjoy.

title: Kakhetia Traditional Winemaking 2013 Quevri Wine Rkatsiteli (Kakheti)
description: Medium gold in the glass, this native Georgian wine made in traditional clay jars has a nose of toffee and peach with a pleasing touch of oxidation. It is harmonious on the palate, offering a sophisticated mélange of toasted apple, vanilla, lemon, toffee and spice flavors. Soft tannins make way for a bright finish with a lingering taste of caramel.

title: Kaleidos 2015 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: This pink blend of 64% Grenache, 31% Syrah and 6% Marsanne offers the expected array of bubblegum, pink roses, peach, watermelon and cool steel aromas on the nose. It's wound nice and tight on the palate, with warm notes of strawberry and bubblegum emerging on the midpalate, leveled by lemon-skin tartness and a chalky tension.

title: Kershaw 2013 Clonal Selection Syrah (Elgin)
description: An elegant and well-balanced Syrah, initial scents of red cherry and brambly berry lead into more refined notes of cola spice, game, leather and a touch of sweet smoke. The palate is smooth and easy, with silky tannins that are surprisingly approachable and red cherry and berry flavors that are bright and refreshing. Final hits of white pepper and cured game grace the medium-length finish.

title: Kontokosta 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Fresh green apple, lemon and gooseberry notes abound in this gorgeously fruity and juicy Sauvignon Blanc. It's surprisingly bold on the palate: full bodied and supple yet balanced. Flavors of ripe white grapefruit and quince are concentrated yet brisk. A hint of musky spray marks the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Lincourt 2013 Willie Mae Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A jubilant nose kicks off with fruit punch before diving a tad darker into pomegranate, candied cherry, anise and cinnamon on this bottling by the Foley family of wines. Raspberry and cherry pop on the mellow and restrained palate, where pencil shavings and garrigue flavorings make for a quality sip.

title: Martha Clara 2014 Northville Red (North Fork of Long Island)
description: While intensely ripe on the nose, this beautifully balanced Bordeaux-style blend offsets luscious fruit with dazzling acidity and a rigid frame of fine tannins. Black plum, cherry and currant flavors are succulent but pristine, penetrating deeply through a long finish. Drinks well now but should improve through 2021.

title: Gorman 2013 The Bully Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Brooding aromas of the blackest of fruit, anise and cassis are followed by a velvet hammer of sweet dried-fruit flavors backed by burly tannins. Medicinal and dark-fruit notes persist on the finish. It seems slightly dried out but still delivers the goods.

title: Finca Patagonia 2013 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Maule Valley)
description: Toasty oak, coffee and rooty berry aromas feed into a full, fleshy but still fresh palate. Black-fruit flavors come with an accent of black coffee, while this blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon and 35% Syrah finishes with toasty mocha and herbal berry flavors.
